data.title: Add API to open a file or diff editor on a specific selection range
Keep file open even when moved from outside

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: Version 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.5 (16F73)

When a file gets moved on the file system without vscode performing the moving action directly, for example with `git mv` in the built-in Terminal, the file in the current workspace is closed. Can the editor keep track of the file and follow it, without closing it?

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a file, open it, and save it
2. from the built in terminal, move the file to another name, or to another folder while keeping the same file name.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: search.history.showPrevious/Next across sessions
data.body: Would be nice if search history for a workspace would be preserved across sessions. For example, I'd like to Alt+UpArrow to searches that I've done yesterday.

data.title: Is the search bar supposed to be a float bar?
data.body:

data.title: [HTML] Multi-line comment issues
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.15063
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Comment a line or two of HTML out.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6901336/27948364-375a23c2-62bf-11e7-8a33-c41d0e721b0c.png)

2. Select a group of lines including the already commented lines, and press `Ctrl+/`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6901336/27948376-404b6284-62bf-11e7-9787-7edb7f489bf1.png)

I believe the `--` should be replaced with `- -` on the inner comments.

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
* VSCODE 1.13.1
* W10 1703
**generally applicable - UX

It frequently bugs me that the default behavior for tabbing in all command-palettesquy-things (such as the fuzzySearch) is to remain on the same level and tabbing through those elements, instead of entering the list of found elements and tabbing through that.
Coming from Atom, this seems very unnatural.

pS. I'll send a pull request myself(?) yay openSource :)

data.title: Fix tpromise callback sig for TS 2.4
data.body:
Fixes #30216

Changes the TPromise callback interface as suggested by https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/30216#issuecomment-313558951 to fix async functions that return a `TPromise`

data.title: Active file's focus is lost after reopen.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1703

I haven't used VsCode for some time. After installing this version of VsCode, I'm glad to see I can close VsCode without being prompted to save modified files, and after I reopen it, the modified files remains. It behaves just like notepad++.
But the problems are:

- The active file's focus is lost after reopen. VsCode always activates the first (left-most) tab.
- The editing history is lost. I know this is not easy, but it is great if VsCode could keep my editing history after reopen, allowing `Ctrl+Z` to work across sessions.

data.title: failed:  Cannot find module 'vscode-languageclient'
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. execute `ext install esformatter` to have my extension [esformatter](https://github.com/leftstick/vscode-esformatter) installed
2. try to format a javascript code
3. click `Help` -> `Toggle Developer Tools`, to have console panel opened

You will get following error:

![screen shot 2017-07-07 at 1 27 05 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1059956/27944211-ff69eb4c-6317-11e7-943f-49bbfad9fb4a.png)

I am pretty sure the dependecy `vscode-languageclient` is in my [package.json](https://github.com/leftstick/vscode-esformatter/blob/master/package.json#L91). with the latest `vsce ls`, i can see the `vscode-languageclient` wasn't packaged. 

BTW, i don't have any problem before, this issue just happened at my recent release. So i am thinking if there is any change i don't know for the `vscode` engine?

Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: Feature request: be able to suppress problems

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I hope VSCode could allow user to suppress problem highlights in code view, and in the down-left corner of the status bar. Sometimes the error highlights are false-positive, or in some cases, an "error" is intended for some reasons (e.g. a spell-checker falsely flags some acronyms).
I searched in the issue list but have found no one has raised it.. it's similar to #30038 but not the same.

data.title: Checking for updates stuck when resuming PC from standby
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Win8.1 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have a project open in VS Code
2. Put your PC into standby
3. Sleep
4. Get up
5. Resume PC from standby

![code_2017-07-07_01-44-08](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/75278/27937248-db8e4874-62b5-11e7-887b-2d6fca1dd040.png)

"Checking for updates..." will stay greyed out forever, can be fixed by restarting VS Code though.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Not tested yet but I assume irrelevant

data.title: Don't Use Async with TPromise in VSCode Codebase
data.body:
Fixes #30216

**Bug**
While compiling vscode with TS 2.4, there were around 10 errors reported about async functions that return a `TPromise`.

**Fix**
I'm checking with the TS team to see if these errors are expected or not. As a workaround, I believe we need to stop using `TPromise` with async functions, at least for now.

This change changes all instances that use `async` to instead use `then`.

data.title: Fix TS 2.4 PromiseLike Errors With Async in VSCode Codebase
data.body:
Building VSCode with TS 2.4, we're seeing about 10 errors in async functions around `TPromise`:

```
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/services/textmodelResolver/test/textModelResolverService.test.ts(136,47): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/services/textmodelResolver/test/textModelResolverService.test.ts(136,47): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
  Type 'TPromise<T | PromiseLike<T>>' is not assignable to type 'PromiseLike<T>'.
    Types of property 'then' are incompatible.
      Type '{ <U>(success?: (value: T | PromiseLike<T>) => TPromise<U>, error?: (err: any) => TPromise<U>, pr...' is not assignable to type '<TResult1 = T, TResult2 = never>(onfulfilled?: (value: T) => TResult1 | PromiseLike<TResult1>, on...'.
        Types of parameters 'success' and 'onfulfilled' are incompatible.
          Types of parameters 'value' and 'value' are incompatible.
            Type 'T | PromiseLike<T>' is not assignable to type 'T'.
              Type 'PromiseLike<T>' is not assignable to type 'T'.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionsViews.ts(119,29): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionsViews.ts(153,38): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionsViews.ts(429,29): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionsViews.ts(447,29): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/parts/extensions/electron-browser/extensionsViewlet.ts(303,28): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/platform/extensionManagement/node/extensionGalleryService.ts(358,44): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
[16:17:43] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/extensionHost.ts(355,118): Type 'typeof TPromise' is not a valid async function return type in ES5/ES3 because it does not refer to a Promise-compatible constructor value.
```

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Using VScode insiders.
2. Clone vscode code base
2. Run `./scripts/npm install`
3. Open vscode codebase in vscode
3. Open effected file
4. Ensure that TS 2.4.1 is active in your workspace by looking in the lower right status bar for the TS version number

data.title: Fix TS 2.4 Error in problemMatcher.ts
data.body:
1. Open `vscode/src/vs/platform/markers/common/problemMatcher.ts` in vscode
1. Ensure that TS 2.4.1 is active in your vscode workspace.

**Error**
```
[15:52:35] Error: /Users/matb/projects/vscode/src/vs/platform/markers/common/problemMatcher.ts(1274,38): Argument of type 'ProblemPattern | ProblemPattern[]' is not assignable to parameter of type 'NamedMultiLineProblemPattern'.
  Type 'ProblemPattern' is not assignable to type 'NamedMultiLineProblemPattern'.
    Property 'name' is missing in type 'ProblemPattern'.
```


data.title: Fix TS 2.4 Error in textFileService.ts
data.body:
**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. Open `workbench/services/textfile/common/textFileService.ts` in the vscode code base
2. Ensure that TS 2.4.1 is active in your vscode workspace. 

**Error**

```
[15:52:35] Error: 
/vscode/src/vs/workbench/services/textfile/common/textFileService.ts(44,23): Class 'TextFileService' incorrectly implements interface 'ITextFileService'.
  Types of property 'revert' are incompatible.
    Type '(resource: URI, options?: IRevertOptions) => TPromise<boolean>' is not assignable to type '(resource: URI, force?: boolean) => TPromise<boolean>'.
      Types of parameters 'options' and 'force' are incompatible.
        Type 'boolean' is not assignable to type 'IRevertOptions'.
```

data.title: Arrow function - Could not determine references via CodeLens
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set typescript.referencesCodeLens.enabled to true in User Settings
2. Open a typescript file and add the following:
```
export function helloWorld1(someNum: number): number{
  return 1;
}
export const helloWorld2 = (someNum: number): number => (1);
```
3. First function will show the number of references while second function will show "Could not determine references"

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes
